questions.question: I .......................... accept that job if they offer a good salary.
questions.description: When the verb in the if-clause is in the simple present tense, we use will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: ....................................... you like to join us?
questions.description: We use would in polite offers.

questions.question: 'There is someone at the door.' 'I ............................. go.'
questions.description: Will is used to announce decisions that we make at the time of speaking.

questions.question: I didn't expect that she ……………………. do this to me.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we use would in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: If she ran faster, she ……………………. win.
questions.description: When the verb in the if-clause is in the simple past tense, we use would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I .................................. get up early if there is a good reason to.
questions.description: When the verb in the if-clause is in the simple present tense, we use will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: Do you think she .................................... come if we invited her?
